title: The Easy Way to Convert an Excel File to a .DAT File

steps.title: Open Microsoft Excel.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Excel. It’s in the Microsoft Office group of the All Apps section of the Windows/Start menu.

steps.title: Click the File menu.
steps.content: Click the File menu. It’s near the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open .

steps.title: Click the file you want to convert.
steps.content: Click the file you want to convert. The file will open in Excel.

steps.title: Click the File menu.
steps.content: Click the File menu.

steps.title: Click Save as….
steps.content: Click Save as… .

steps.title: Navigate to the folder where you want to save the file.
steps.content: Navigate to the folder where you want to save the file.

steps.title: Click the “Save as type” drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the “Save as type” drop-down menu. A list of file types will appear.

steps.title: Select CSV (Comma delimited)(*.cvs).
steps.content: Select CSV (Comma delimited)(*.cvs) . This will create a file that can be converted to .DAT format.

steps.title: Type a name for the file.
steps.content: Type a name for the file. It goes into the “File name” field. If you want to accept the current name you can skip this step.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . The .CSV file is saved and ready to be converted.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+E.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + E . This opens the file explorer.

steps.title: Navigate to the folder where you saved the .CSV file.
steps.content: Navigate to the folder where you saved the .CSV file. Don’t click the file once you open the folder, just bring it onto the screen.

steps.title: Right-click the file to convert.
steps.content: Right-click the file to convert.

steps.title: Select Open with….
steps.content: Select Open with… . A list of apps will appear.

steps.title: Click Notepad.
steps.content: Click Notepad . The file will open in the Notepad app.

steps.title: Click the File menu.
steps.content: Click the File menu. It’s near the top-left corner of Notepad.

steps.title: Click Save As….
steps.content: Click Save As… .

steps.title: Click the “Save as type” drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the “Save as type” drop-down menu. It’s below the “File name” field. A list of file types will appear.

steps.title: Select All Files (*.*).
steps.content: Select All Files (*.*) . Choosing this option allows you to specify your own file extension.

steps.title: Rename the file with .DAT at the end.
steps.content: Rename the file with .DAT at the end. For example, if the “File name” field currently says Book1.txt , change it to Book1.dat . It doesn’t matter whether the letters in .DAT are capital or lowercase.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . The original file is now saved in the .DAT format.
